intro: Olfersia gorgonea, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family native to South America. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its humid environment. Olfersia gorgonea is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
